reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fairly new hotel and it is situated a little oddly between a baseball field and rail yard. There is aslo a hospital emergency room a few blocks away,but the construction is such that we heard nothing from the street inside our room. We loved the way the room was designed with one thing that wasn't quite right. The air conditioner unit (controlled by wall thermostat) is located under the window. Because of the suite design there is a partial wall between the bed area and the living room area. Most of the cold air would trap behind the wall making the bed area like a freezer and the living room area comfortable. The real problem was the bath. No fan and none of the cooler air was making it toward the hallway end of the room, so the bath never dried off and it took quite a while for mirrors to unfog.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and a great staff

reviews.text: The bedding and the bed itself was beautiful and comfortable. The living room furniture was comfortable and I loved the desk area-very functional. The room has a tv in the bed area and the living room area and because the closet was between them you really could watch a different program on each without disturbing the other person. The coffee bar area with a microwave and refrigerator suited our needs.
reviews.title: The place to stay in Roanoke!

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant once for dinner and it was OK. Nothing special. Hotel prices.
reviews.title: Flotsam and Jetsam

reviews.text: Front desk staff and housekeeping staff were great-personable and efficient. We encountered the manager a couple of times, and while she was friendly she also took the time to tell us she had to work double shifts and wasn't thinking very clearly. We didn't need to hear that.
reviews.title: Modern and Chic but poor customer service

reviews.text: The pool and spa were nice but the chemicals in the spa were a little high in concentration. We didn't use the work out room, but the pool area and workout area were clean, plenty of towels.
reviews.title: Bedford Schools Inspection

reviews.text: My wife and I were in Roanoke to attend a concert so we were looking for a reasonably priced hotel for the night. We found it in the Cambria Suites! The room was quiet, and had every modern convenience. The light blocking drapes allowed us to sleep in late. We had the breakfast buffet in the morning with a nicely stocked buffet table and a friendly staff. We will stay here again if we are ever in the area.
reviews.title: Really nice modern place to stay!
Nice hotel in terrible location.
reviews.text: Very nice, newer property. But it is located adjacent to a rail yard and across from old buildings in process of falling down. NOTHING is walkable re. restaurants, coffee shops, etc.

We were in the area for the VA Tech/Appalachian State game on Labor Day weekend, 2011. Stayed in Roanoke instead of Blacksburg as prices in Blacksburg were outrageous for even a shoddy hotel. This place had terrific reviews, so went with it, and very glad we did. The hotel itself is very nice, and great value for the price. Some reviewers commented about the area being sketchy, but it is apparent that the area is in the midst of a renewal phase, as an older building next door was being torn down. We had no problems.
reviews.title: Terrific stay

reviews.text: That said, the room was fabulous! Decor was very nice, and the king suite we stayed in had a sitting area, with a sleeper sofa. Nice TVs. The bathroom is very very nice, upscale fixtures (we know fixtures...we own a plumbing contracting business), nice tile shelf at the back end of the tup for toiletries, or to sit on to shave your legs.
reviews.title: It was Excellent,one of the nicest suites we have ever stayed in!!!

reviews.text: Beds were comfortable and the linens were very soft...so were the bathroom towels. Staff was very nice, very helpful when we asked questions.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever for the Money

reviews.text: This Cambria Suites hotel was a great surprise! Totally new hotel, with many extras- one of the best bathrooms of any hotel in it's grade. We could not believe the quality versus the value of the room! I stayed in a King suite with my 2 kids, and my parents had another room. Many luxury features, and a wonderful nights stay.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night when visiting our good friends in Roanoke. We chose the hotel because it is around the corner from them and we couldn't have made a better choice. The hotel was very nice. Everything was in great condition, all very clean and well decorated. The room was pricey, especially considering no meals but like I said...definitely worth it. We'll stay here again when we visit next time.

reviews.text: Let me count the ways: Very modern and stylish, terrific bed, the best pillows, magnifying mirror in bathroom, night light in bathroom (GREAT idea!), great big shower with place to sit, beautiful view of mountain (with a star on top!), 2 (count them two!) TVs with HBO and Showtime, above average coffee service w/ organic tea, brand new fridge and microwave, free WIFI, a powerful blow dryer (not the dinky kind stuck to the wall), all sparkling clean and new, and top it off with a super friendly staff.
reviews.title: How do I love thee?

reviews.text: We stayed at the Cambria Suites in Roanoke for a nearby destination wedding Sept. 30-Oct. 2 and absolutely loved this hotel! We rented two rooms for two nights and would highly recommend it. The lobby is really beautiful with a huge natural stone wall and inviting furniture. My husband and I slept very well on the king bed with a fantastic pillow-top mattress and the most luxurious pillows - I want to buy some of them! Our 15-year-old son was very comfortable on the pull-out couch on the other side of the room divider. Our older daughters were in the room next door and were also impressed with the decor and amenities. Everyone liked the beautiful fixtures in the bathrooms! The wifi worked perfectly, which was important to us. The fitness room was very nice, with a great view of the hot tub and indoor pool where we had a fun family volleyball game. Every single staff member was very courteous and helpful. The manager personally took time to write out excellent directions for us when we had to make a quick trip to Target. We would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: 1st Class all the way!

reviews.text: New hotel, great fitness center. Great bathroom and bedding. Enjoyed staing here! I'm giving breakfast an "average" rating because is not included in the room rate. Otherwise it was a good selection.
reviews.title: Convenient, good value

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend while in for a reunion. the hotel was clean and staff very friendly. thought the breakfast for $9.00 a little pricey, but that withstanding overall experience excellent. the fitness/spa area very nice and clean. will reccomend to all.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong...

reviews.text: The Cambria Roanoke is awesome. I stay in business traveller hotels a bunch. I have recently come to know Cambria. Great up and coming brand. I hope to see more out there soon. I am a huge fan now. The Roanoke Cambria is awesome. Can't go wrong here.
